page.title: 01NEW ALRESFORD HAMPSHIRE
page.content: {New Alresford}(population 4219 for the 1982 Census) a rural town packed with antique, book and art shops. The name means 'ford by the alders' and is pronounced 'Allsford'; New isn't used, although the ajoining village is 'Old Alresford'. The town is situated between Winchester and Farnham on the busy A31 road.A bypass has just been started after many years of waiting. Alresford is a smart residential area and was already a busy corn, woollen, farming and sheep-market town when William the Conqueror settled in Winchester. Now it is associated with agriculture and is the centre of a thriving watercress industry. Hence, also, the so called Watercress Railway Line.
